study.title: Powershap: A Power-full Shapley Feature Selection Method
study.abstract: Powershap is a novel wrapper feature selection method leveraging statistical hypothesis testing and power calculations with Shapley values. It outperforms other filter methods and matches wrapper methods' performances while being significantly faster.

results.general: Powershap provides strong feature selection with faster execution times compared to traditional wrapper methods and some state-of-the-art alternatives.

accuracy.informative_features_found: Up to 73% for datasets with 500 features and 90% informative features in convergence mode
accuracy.noise_features_selected: Limited noise features selected, outperforming others

simulation_results.speed: Fastest among wrapper methods in simulation tests

benchmark_results.performance: Consistently among the best or equal in performance to other methods across various datasets, especially in terms of execution time and feature set quality

study.conclusion: Powershap is a competitive, fast, and reliable feature selection method ready for integration in machine learning pipelines.
